author: Harper Lee
review: To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee is a masterpiece of American literature that delves deep into the issues of racism, prejudice, and morality in the Southern United States during the 1930s. Set in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama, the novel follows the Finch family, particularly young Scout Finch, as she grows up and learns about the complexities of human nature. At the heart of the story is the trial of Tom Robinson, a black man falsely accused of raping a white woman.
